title: ICE: `const variables should not be hashed` /  `cannot relate consts of different types`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![crate_type = "lib"] trait Q { const ASSOC: usize; } impl Q for [u8; N] {} pub fn q_user() -> [u8; <[u8; 13] as Q>::ASSOC] {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (13afbdaa0 2023-03-17) binary: rustc commit-hash: 13afbdaa0655dda23d7129e59ac48f1ec88b2084 commit-date: 2023-03-17 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output `rustc file.rs -Cincremental=.` ``` - ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'const variables should not be hashed: Var(_#0c)', compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/consts/kind.rs:145:35 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f7b06f6739a -
